intro: Scepocarpus sansibaricus, commonly known as the East African scecocarp, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow fruits that mature in the dry season, attracting various bird species. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and mangrove forests. Due to its unique ecological role, it is considered an important component of the local flora.
